file_content.text: I assure you, Sith, once this is over, House Thul will be renegotiating its relationship with the Empire.
I hope you find what you seek, Sith, and I hope it is worth it.
House Thul is once more indebted to the Empire, and of course, to you personally.
The Elysium is where the houses keep their dearest treasures. I'm sure you'll find something of value.
Thank you again, Sith. House Thul is once more secure. I don't know what would've happened without you.
Ah, Sith! We just received word from House Organa. They want a temporary truce. Apparently, you were too much for them.
All in service to you, my lady.
It was an honor.
It's a shame. He was a valuable asset to our house.
He was clearly weak.
You call him an asset?
I suppose strength is all a Sith really cares about. Strength and power.
He had his uses.
I'm over it.
Well, whatever that means, I'm sorry.
At least you still have one useful Sith.
Not as valuable as me.
Callous, but true, in its own way.
We had grown close.
Yes, a shame.
Well, for that I'm sorry.
I'm sorry for your loss.
That's kind of you.
I cut through their Jedi like butter.
It was easy.
Yes, that's the impression I got.
Sith! So sorry to interrupt you. I hope your meeting with Lady Rist went well.
I was able to persuade her to my way of seeing things.
You could say that.
You'll have your artifact soon, then. I'm glad to hear it.
Just get to the point.
What do you want?
Like I said, I'm very sorry to trouble you, but we have a problem on our hands, and you may be the only one who can solve it.
Tell me the situation and I'll see what I can do.
Fill me in.
Oh, thank you.
If I had fifty credits for every time someone said that....
As usual.
What makes you think I have time for your problems?
Don't be stupid.
Will you at least please listen to my request? I assure you I would not trespass upon your time if it were not urgent.
I have intelligence that Organa is preparing a reprisal for your raid on House Alde.
According to our spy, Organa has assembled a contingent of Jedi to attack House Thul. I sent Urtel and his Sith to investigate, but they haven't returned.
You should've asked me first.
You sent that fool?
I didn't want to impose. I had no idea Organa's Jedi were so powerful.
Do you think Urtel's been killed?
Oh no.
We've lost contact, and I fear the worst.
I just don't see how this is my problem.
What's the big deal?
You can't be serious.
We are your Empire's chief ally here on Alderaan. We've helped you locate your artifact and lure Nomar Organa to the planet.
There is also much that Thul can provide you--many powerful items. But if you don't help us, Organa's Jedi will crush us.
What do you need me to do?
Oh, all right.
Powerful items you say.
Now you have my attention.
Please, all I ask is that you locate and take out Organa's Jedi contingent within House Organa before they have a chance to strike.
And if you could find out what happened to Urtel and the other Sith, I would appreciate that as well, but the Jedi are first priority.
Of course.
This will be quick.
Thank you. And I assure you, House Thul is a generous ally.
Thul also has a vault in the Elysium, and the key will be yours once our safety is assured.
Organa will expect an attack and be heavily guarded. Please hurry--I don't know how much time we have!
Forget it.
Enjoy the bloodbath.
Have fun with that.
How could you--you....
You'll have to fight your way into House Rist and convince Rehanna Rist to lure Nomar to the planet if you want the artifact.
Ah, Sith. Sorry to keep you waiting.
I hope your search in House Alde was fruitful. I've been anxiously dreaming up scandals we could catch the spotless Nomar Organa in.
I found this holorecording.
Here.
Not really a scandal, but he was engaged once.
Our Jedi was in love.
Engaged? Interesting. Jedi aren't usually the marrying kind.
This should allow us to sink our hooks into him.
Just this tasty morsel.
Let me see. "Engagement Announcement--Nomar and Rehanna." My goodness. This is juicy!
It must have been somewhere between twenty, thirty years ago--long before I was born, but I remember hearing my nurses talking about it.
The sister to the lord of House Rist was engaged to a prominent noble against the wishes of both their families, but the coward broke it off.
You think this Rehanna is Lord Rist's sister?
I see.
It's a perfect fit.
And here I thought Jedi were supposed to keep their promises.
That coward was Nomar Organa.
I don't know about that, but the timing of this holorecording is right, as is the name--Rehanna.
Where is this girl now? What is she doing?
And then what?
Oh, Lady Rehanna Rist has developed quite the reputation.
Rist is a house of highly trained assassins, and Lady Rist is no exception.
But she is perhaps most noted for her stubborn refusal to marry--and for the humiliations she pours on those who ask.
Looks like Lady Rist and I need to chat.
Then I know what I must do.
Yes, I'd say so, too.
She sounds like loads of fun.
My kind of girl.
And more importantly, like she's still in love with Nomar Organa.
Do you think she still loves Nomar Organa?
She sounds obsessed.
I'd say it's a fair bet.
If Rehanna is Lady Rist--I think it's quite clear that she is--then the suitor is our perfect Jedi, Nomar Organa.
And if she is still in love with Nomar, then you may be able to convince her to lure Nomar to Alderaan.
My words will be sweet as honey.
I will be most persuasive.
If arguments fail, I have other ways.
There's always lightning.
Whatever method you prefer--though I hope it doesn't come to that.
Assassin or Jedi, they will both obey.
Everyone bends in the end.
But be wary--to reach Rehanna Rist, you'll have to contend with the deadliest assassins on Alderaan. Good luck, Sith.
Good to see you again, friend.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I have a report to make to my lady.
What's your report about?
Fill me in.
There are rumors that House Organa is planning a strike.
The Lady Elana wanted me to find out if there's any truth to them.
They're just rumors.
They can wait.
Well, yes, if you put it that way. I suppose there's no hurry.
Did you have something in mind for the interim?
Passion before duty, Sith.
[Flirt] Don't be so serious.
If House Thul ever needs my help....
Can I assist?
It's my duty to protect House Thul, not yours. But I appreciate the offer.
Now, if you'll excuse me. Business is business. Good day, and good luck, Sith.
I was hoping to get to know you better.
[Flirt] It can wait, can't it?
Did you have something in mind? My report will keep.
I think you can guess.
[Flirt] Do you need specifics?
I thought you might show me where you live in this place.
A tour maybe?
I was hoping you'd think of something.
Do you have a suggestion?
Well, I don't know. Let me see.
I do have some very comfortable rooms nearby. I could order us some food, some wine.
We could talk more freely there.
I don't want us to be disturbed.
Forget the food.
As you wish.
Lead the way.
Good. Excellent.
My Lady Elana, if you will excuse us.
Well, that was... very pleasant, wasn't it? But I shouldn't keep you any longer--you still have a great deal to do.
Thank you for the lovely time.
That was nice.
I'm glad you enjoyed yourself.
I hope we'll get to do that again sometime.
When will I see you?
As do I.
But I know I shouldn't keep you any longer--as much as I want to.
Your voice irritates me.
Shut up.
Well, I'm--I'm sorry. I guess.
Um, good luck finding your artifact, then. It was an honor to have met you.
Well, that took a while. It's alright; I found my own tour guide.
Sweet young lady that mucks out the thranta stables. Almost nobility, but without the stink.
Don't worry. I got everything I wanted out of him.
I'm done with him.
Good. Let's get that artifact of yours and leave this overblown pageant of a planet.
The four of us could have a dinner party!
Wonderful!
She's not the dinner-party type, sorry.
Your jealousy is intolerable.
Shut up.
Jealous? I'm bored senseless. This place got too many manners.
On second thought, maybe some other time.
Never mind.
I'm sorry to have given you cause for second thoughts, then.
But I eagerly anticipate "some other time." Good day.
I won't hold you up.
Don't let me distract you.
On the contrary, always a pleasure to talk to you.
I hope your search is going well, my lord.
Keep me apprised of the situation, Urtel. We may need to take action.
Go to House Alde and see what you can learn about Nomar Organa.
My lady, this must be the Sith we've been expecting. I can feel her power.
My lady, this must be the Sith we've been expecting. I can feel his power.
Welcome, Sith. I'm sorry for the chaos--Alderaan is on the brink of civil war. But House Thul owes the Empire so much.
What did the Empire do for you?
What do you mean?
Before I was born, House Thul was accused of conspiring to steal the throne. We were disgraced and driven off Alderaan.
The Empire gave us a home in exile and helped restore us to our rightful place on Alderaan.
It's my pleasure.
How gracious.
The Empire isn't all it's cracked up to be.
Don't be so naive.
Every government has its flaws.
If not for the Empire, House Thul--I--would not be on Alderaan today.
But our history can hardly be of interest to you. Darth Zash mentioned you're after a certain artifact, am I correct?
You've heard correctly.
Yes, my lady.
Excellent--then I should be able to help quite a bit.
I'm not telling you.
Fair enough. But from what little I know, I may be able to help you.
You're going to help me find it, am I correct?
That depends.
I hope as much.
Allow me to introduce Urtel Moren. He's my personal Sith guard. He did some preliminary investigation after Darth Zash called.
It is an honor. I have heard many things about Lord Zash's apprentice.
Charmed to meet such a renowned... and beautiful Sith.
I began my research on a hunch--House Organa has close ties to the Jedi. We captured and "chatted with" a chamberlain of House Organa.
He confirmed that Organa holds the artifact, and that it is kept in their private vault in the Elysium.
What's the Elysium?
The Elysium?
The Elysium is an ancient and majestic ruin on Alderaan now reduced to a battlefield.
Isn't House Organa your sworn enemy?
How convenient.
If we want to launch an attack, we don't need to resort to tricks.
How dare you torture someone without me!
I missed the fun!
Apologies. I will be sure to bring you in on the fun next time.
Unfortunately, the Elysium is sealed tight, and the key is held by Nomar Organa, a powerful, revered and insufferable Jedi Master.
You are the only Sith on Alderaan who even stands a chance of defeating Nomar. We must bring him here.
Nomar Organa has a reputation for strength and power, but above all, for his principles. He is, by all accounts, the perfect Jedi.
But everyone has weaknesses. Isn't that right?
You hit it right on the head.
Exactly.
Everyone has weaknesses, but especially Jedi.
Jedi are the most vulnerable.
Bring him here and I'll twist his arm.
He will help or suffer.
I suggest you start in the library of House Alde. They are devoted keepers of Alderaan's history.
Personal connections, I think, would be most useful--siblings he was particularly close to, childhood friends.
But be careful--House Alde is a close ally of Organa. They'll likely attack anyone from Thul on sight.
Sith. It's an honor to meet you.
Did I hear it right? Did Darth Zash really send you?
She is my master.
Of course.
So it's true. I'm honored, really.
Why do you care?
That's not your business.
Please don't take offense. I'm simply honored to meet you.
If you have a problem with Zash, you have a problem with me.
Be careful.
No problem--it's fantastic.
You were part of that group of slaves they brought to the Academy for training, weren't you?
They say it was you who killed Darth Skotia.
I don't know anything about that.
Who?
What if I told you they're right?
What if I did?
I'd say I'm impressed--and then I'd want to know how you did it.
I've killed a lot of people.
Let me think....
Secretive. I see. Suit yourself, I didn't mean to pry.
But if I were responsible for one of the biggest coups in recent Sith history, I'd want people to know.
You're a glory hound and I'm not.
I'm not you.
It's enough for people to think they know.
I like the suspense.
Secrecy is a Sith's best weapon.
I have reason to be quiet.
Still, how did you do it?
That would be telling.
I promise not to tell anyone. And I'm sure it's an impressive story.
Easy.
I can tell you're powerful, but Skotia was practically Dark Council caliber. So, it wasn't just power.
I am an impressive person.
Of course it is.
That much is certainly clear.
It wasn't special.
That smacks of false humility--hardly becoming of a Sith.
For now, your curiosity will have to wait.
Maybe I'll tell you some time.
My curiosity is most impatient.
I'm not your average Sith.
Most Sith lack subtlety.
Perhaps if I knew you better....
[Flirt.] Well....
I certainly hope we'll get a chance to get to know each other better.
There are other Sith on Alderaan, but it's rare to get the time to just talk.
I hope we do more than just talk.
[Flirt] Is that all?
Well, uh, maybe we can both get our wish.
It's a privilege to be treasured.
I agree.
Good. Maybe we'll have the opportunity to talk again.
Perhaps because it's boring.
Yawn.
Well, uh--I'm sorry, then.
I need to do some work for my lady right now, but in the meantime, good luck.
Getting a little friendly, huh. There's only one way that ends, far as I've seen.
It was just a conversation, Andronikos.
I don't know what you mean.
He's just a toy. I'll play and throw him away when he stops being new and shiny.
Don't be jealous.
Well, he don't look very new or shiny now. But then, all these nobles kinda rub me wrong.
I don't see why I should have to explain my actions to you.
And?
Thought you might've been stabbed in the back enough times to know better than to trust another Sith. That's all.
I'm not jealous or nothing.
I guess it's none of my business, huh.
It's a pleasure to meet you, Sith.
I'm sorry, but I'm very busy right now.
What about Urtel Moren?
And the other Sith?
Unfortunately, he was killed. Organa agreed to return his body and those of the other Sith however, as part of the truce.
I suppose that's small consolation. I realize you two had grown rather... close.
If I had realized how weak he was, I wouldn't have bothered.
That was a mistake.
Lady Elana.
Ah, Urtel, you've made it back. Excellent....
I'm on my way to meet Nomar Organa now.
It did.
Please, you must stop House Organa's Jedi.
Thank you so much, Sith.
As your reward, here is the key to Thul's private vault within the Elysium. The contents are yours.
Do you know what's in this vault?
The contents?
I'm sorry, the exact records were lost when we were driven into exile
My gratitude.
It's my honor, Sith.
It will all soon be mine.
Wonderful.
Um, right, well....
Urtel Moren is dead.
Not your concern, Lady.
